entry.title: Censorship
entry.summary: The context discusses the need for decentralized communication mechanisms and forums, which would not be controlled by anyone. The writer provides a link to a subreddit dedicated to peer-to-peer communications and expresses interest in contributing to making these forums more popular. The difficulty of creating truly censorship-resistant forums is also acknowledged, with particular challenges posed by spam, abuse, overloading, and the potential for attacks. The centralization and censorship of the Bitcoin community are identified as factors inhibiting its advancement and growth. The writer proposes creating a heavily moderated forum that would provide an official seal of approval and regular presence of top XT people. This approach would require leadership and a will to set up proper moderation, with the aim of attracting users away from centralized forums.
